    • Uses of OdometerExceptions in ca.mcgill.ecse211.ARR

      Methods in ca.mcgill.ecse211.ARR that throw OdometerExceptions 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void Navigation.correctOdometer()
      This method is used when the robot is traveling either horizontally or vertically and its light sensors have stopped on top of the lines.
      static void AutonomousRetrievalRobot.initialize()
      Initializes the sensors and motors, starts odometer thread, and initializes class variables with the proper sensors/motors they require.
      static void AutonomousRetrievalRobot.main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static void Navigation.travelStartToTunnel()
      Method asssumes robot done localizing, takes coordinates and calculates the trajectory to the tunnel based on four cases.
      static void Navigation.travelToWithCorrection(double x, double y)
      This method makes the robot move in the direction of the waypoint whose coordinates are passed as arguments.
      static void Navigation.travelTunnelToRingSet()
      This method takes the robot from just having gone outside the tunnel to the ring set so that it is in position to start circling the set detecting the ring colors.
